editor.label: Application Server - JBoss UndeployApp
editor.description: Undeploy an application in JBoss server.

formElement.label: Configuration name:
formElement.documentation: Name of the configuration to be used. URL and credentials are retrieved from the given configuration. To view or create a new configuration, go to the Administration -> Plugins tab, and select 'Configure' action for @PLUGIN_KEY@ plugin.
formElement.htmlDocumentation:
Name of the configuration to be used. URL and credentials are retrieved from the given configuration.
A Configuration defines connection details and can be created by going to plugin configuration page.

formElement.label: Physical location of the jboss client script:
formElement.documentation: Provide the physical location of the jboss Command Line Interface script, i.e: 'jboss-cli.bat', '/path/to/jboss-cli.sh'. If omitted, script location from configuration will be used.

formElement.label: Deployment name:
formElement.documentation: Unique name of the application (deployment) to undeploy.

formElement.label: Apply undeploy to all server groups:
formElement.documentation: Select this option to apply undeploy to all server groups in which the deployment is enabled. Either server-groups or all-relevant-server-groups is required in domain mode. This argument is not applicable in standalone mode.

formElement.label: Server groups to apply:
formElement.documentation: Provide the comma-separated list of server group names the undeploy command applies to.

formElement.label: Keep content:
formElement.documentation: Select this option to disable the deployment and keep the content of the deployment, or unselect it to disable the deployment and removes its content from the repository.
